alert.note: Alert for Coshocton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 8:13PM EDT until March 28 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Ohio... Stillwater Creek At Uhrichsville affecting Tuscarawas County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County. .A strong storm system has produced moderate to heavy rainfall. This rainfall has resulted in rises on rivers and streams. More rain is forecast over the next next 24 hours.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.to rise rapidly Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC031-251215- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0003.230325T2248Z-230328T0800Z/ /CSHO1.1.ER.230325T2248Z.230326T1800Z.230328T0200Z.NO/ 813 PM EDT Fri Mar 24 2023 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muskingum River at Coshocton. * WHEN...From Saturday evening to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water reaches low lying areas between Tuscarawas and Walhonding Rivers just upstream of the confluence of the two rivers. At 15.0 feet, Low areas are flooded and water reaches a few homes along Route 16 south of Coshocton and along County Route 1A north of Coshocton. At 16.0 feet, Flood waters begin to affect the Lake Park area along the Walhonding River and begins backwater flooding along Mill Creek north of Lake Park and along Route 83. Flood waters will begin to enter yards in low-lying areas along County Route 1A. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EDT Friday the stage was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 15.8 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Monday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.9 feet on 02/13/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
